sentence.Network_en: Robin said pompously that he had an important business appointment.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗宾傲慢地说他有一个重要的工作约会。
他很夸耀地描述了自己所取得的成绩.

entry.def: If you describe someone as pompous, you mean that they behave or speak in a very serious way because they think they are more important than they really are.

example.ex: He was somewhat pompous and had a high opinion of his own capabilities.

entry.def: A pompous building or ceremony is very grand and elaborate.

example.ex: The service was grand without being pompous.
example.tran: 仪式场面宏大，却不浮华。

auth_sentence.content: It was not what they were looking for and pompously ignored.

auth_sentence.content: "I pompously consider myself to be someone who hates to idle on beaches, so I figured I'd be immune to its charms," he says.
